results.title: Insects that live in big families
results.brief_description: Examines the habits and social systems of insects that live in large groups, including bees, wasps, ants, ants, aphids and termites. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Insects helpful to man
results.brief_description: Shows how humans benefit from the the activities of some insects. Includes a discussion of the benefits derived from bees, silkworms, maggots, dung beetles, lady bugs and ichneumon flies. Suitable for lower secondary level.
results.description: Shows how humans benefit from the the activities of some insects. Includes a discussion of the benefits derived from bees, silkworms, maggots, dung beetles, lady bugs and ichneumon flies. Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: Insects and their homes
results.brief_description: Insects homes are of many forms, exist in numerous places, and are made of many kinds of materials. We observe a variety of such homes, from the simple cocoon in which the moth develops to the complex ant colony, and we see the many ways in which such homes help their inhabitants to survive.

results.title: Insects
results.brief_description: Describes the characteristics of insects and records the drama of metamorphosis and the flurry of activity inside a beehive. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Insect zoo [col]
results.brief_description: Two children make an insect zoo in their yard. By close-up photography several insects are distinguished and simple homes in which they can be kept are shown.

results.title: Insect tissue culture
results.creator_credit: CSIRO, Alice O'Donnell and David Corke
results.brief_description: Techniques for the tissue culture of cells from insects are shown and various features of the growth of the cells analysed, before and after infection with a polyhedral virus disease.

results.title: Insect life cycle: the periodical cicada. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: The life cycle of the Periodical Cicada. The camera traces it from egg-laying, through the years underground, and the emergence from the nymph state, to the mating of the mature adult. Time-lapse photography is used to show a nymph emerging, and the process that follows to development of the wings of a mature adult.
